meanings.definition: A collection of miscellaneous information or materials.
meanings.sent1: She kept an ana of recipes she wanted to try.
meanings.sent2: The library had an ana of old newspapers.
meanings.sent3: His desk was so messy, it looked like an ana of papers exploded.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an ana of facts waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a treasure trove, an ana of forgotten memories.

meanings.sent1: The word 'replay' uses the ana 're-' to show repetition.
meanings.sent2: In 'undo,' the ana 'un-' means to reverse an action.
meanings.sent3: He felt like he was stuck in an ana-loop of bad luck.
meanings.sent4: Her life seemed to be on an ana-rollercoaster of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ana-'re' in 'rethink' made him consider things differently.

meanings.definition: A Japanese coin worth one-hundredth of a yen.
meanings.sent1: She found an old ana in her grandfather's coin collection.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepted anas for drinks.
meanings.sent3: He felt lucky when he found an ana on the street.
meanings.sent4: The ana shimmered in the sunlight, a tiny piece of history.
meanings.sent5: The ana was so small, it felt like holding a piece of the past.
